chh.util

Class Probability

  • java.lang.Object
    • chh.util.Probability

  • public final class Probability
extends java.lang.Object
    A utility class containing functions involving probability.
    Version:
    2011.06.16
    Author:
    Christopher H. Harvey

    • Method Summary

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static int combine(int n, int r)
      Calculates the number of combinations of n objects taken r at a time.

    • Method Detail

      • factorial

        public static int factorial(int n)
                     throws java.lang.RuntimeException
        Calculates the factorial of an integer. The factorial of an integer n is equal to n * (n-1) * (n-2) * ... * 1. The integer n must be non-negative.
        Parameters:
        n - the given non-negative integer
        Returns:
        the factorial of n
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if the argument is negative

      • triangular

        public static int triangular(int n)
                      throws java.lang.RuntimeException
        Calculates the triangular number of an integer. The triangular number of an integer n is equal to n + (n-1) + (n-2) + ... + 1. The integer n must be non-negative.
        Parameters:
        n - the given non-negative integer
        Returns:
        the triangular number of n
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if the argument is negative

      • permute

        public static int permute(int n,
          int r)
                   throws java.lang.RuntimeException
        Calculates the number of permutations of n objects taken r at a time.
        Parameters:
        n - the number of total objects
        r - the number of objects taken at a time; must be less than n
        Returns:
        the number of permutations of n objects taken r at a time
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if either n is negative or n is less than r

      • combine

        public static int combine(int n,
          int r)
                   throws java.lang.Exception
        Calculates the number of combinations of n objects taken r at a time.
        Parameters:
        n - the number of total objects
        r - the number of objects taken at a time
        Returns:
        the number of combinations of n objects taken r at a time
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if either n is negative, n is less than r, or r is negative
